intro: Brachycarpaea varians, commonly known as the variable brachycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing adaptability to harsh environments. Its botanical features include a short, stout stem and a basal rosette of leaves, which help it conserve moisture. Brachycarpaea varians is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
